text: Brunei–Spain relations are the bilateral and diplomatic relations between these two countries. Brunei has no embassy in Spain, but his embassy in Paris, France, is accredited to Spain.List of foreign embassies in Spain . Spain has no embassy in Brunei but its embassy in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, is accredited for Brunei.Ficha de Brunei Office of Diplomatic Information. Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation. Section: Spanish Representation Data. == Diplomatic relations == Spain and Brunei established diplomatic relations in June 1984. Spain does not have a resident Embassy in Brunei, managing issues related to the Sultanate the Embassy of Spain in Kuala Lumpur (Malaysia). Brunei also does not have an Embassy resident in Spain, managing issues related to Spain from the Embassy of the Sultanate of Brunei in Paris. Bilateral relations are cordial thanks to the absence of disputes and the relations that the Sultan and his family have with the Spanish Royal Family, if Well still, below its potential.Ficha de Brunei Office of Diplomatic Information. Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation. Section: Diplomatic relations. == Cooperation == UNDP places Brunei in the category of developed countries according to the Human Development Index published annually. Brunei is not considered by the Spanish authorities as a priority country for development cooperation. There is no Technical Cooperation Office of Spain in Brunei.Ficha de Brunei Office of Diplomatic Information. Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation. Section: Cooperation. ==See also== * Foreign relations of Brunei * Foreign relations of Spain == References == Spain Brunei
title: Brunei–Spain relations
